Method to get high stats (DMM's perfected method)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Raising Methods: Method to get high stats (DMM's perfected method)
By DigMoshMogi on Tuesday, October 23, 2001 - 05:33 pm:

This is a long slow method. Make sure you have the holy goblet, beaming rock, and aroma pot. You will only raise your monster the week of tournies and the week before the season changes. Other times you will raise a 'dummy' monster. Battle early in the offical battles to raise rank and skill sense. When on ventures use all 3 noisy halls and search the rare spots if you get a warning dont search unless you need saucer stone pieces or bits. I did this with a fruit. Always save so you dont stress out your monster or get failures. When a monster fails and is not 'full of energy' try another drill or rest. Raise untill your monster asks for rest.
Step 1 raise 2 stats at the expense of 1 bottoming out the stat this will give you gains up to and over 30. Dont max stats only raise a stat if it is less than 970.
Step 2 either continue step 1 with other stats or raise at the expense of a stat that is too high and go back to step 1 if necessary.
Step3 raise the last stat/s try to keep all the other stats high.
Keep me posted on how monsters with this method are doing.
Special thanks to ToreyLuvullo for helping me plan this out.
I have heard this is a lot like DP's method but I got the idea from Lisa's MR1 method.

my mogi named migo 1yr 6mo
259-796-2-829-349
punch in lv4
dig lv2
break spin lv5
dig mosh lv8

By torey luvullo on Tuesday, October 23, 2001 - 05:37 pm:

so if you raise it on the 4th week of every month, into the first, you have to feed it before you can freeze it, right? what do you feed it?

By DigMoshMogi on Tuesday, October 23, 2001 - 05:44 pm:

I fed it every month whatever had a 4 in nutrition with the highest favorites. making sure you have high favorites may be good if you monster gets stressed out. I dont know if you have to feed it every time it may not benifit at all every time. I dont know if this is completely true but a 2 in favorites in the second stage on may make more 'greats' and successful drills.

By DigMoshMogi on Wednesday, October 24, 2001 - 07:57 am:

more on bottoming out stats. I would suggest bottoming out a good stat like speed an a tiger. this will make it easier to gain it back. I'm running into trouble with my mogi because int is the hardest to bottom out and raise others. This method will also get you high levels for techs in fact it was originally to max out techs for more on this check out the section 'more math from superbk'.

By torey_luvullo on Wednesday, October 24, 2001 - 04:55 pm:

By danz on Wednesday, October 24, 2001 - 05:00 pm:

By DigMoshMogi on Wednesday, October 24, 2001 - 05:31 pm:

yes it suffers a disadvantage but look at my monsters levels. you get around 1/5 or better than not freezing but you get 12Xs. in fact is the reason I started this method was to max monsters moves. I dont think this mogi will max but my next one may. the easiest stats to lower and raise others evenly are in this order speed, power, defense, intelligence. I found out intelligence is the extremely hard to do.

By DigMoshMogi on Thursday, October 25, 2001 - 11:57 am:

my first 3000+ monster Mogi-Migo 2yr 3mo
583-975-10-981-528. I am missing 2 levels on dig but I'm not going to worry about it. The stats gained on ventures is minimal but it adds up quick. I suggest maxxing one move for the first monster making sure you know what move will be the forte. Get the move on the next monster then feed it the heart.

By Aaron Guest a.k.a. Magma Bird on Friday, October 26, 2001 - 08:21 pm:

My first Monster, a Lesione, had 400-350-600-450-150, and beat for of the top five. I gave it no special items except horns, wich didn't seem to affect anything.

My third Monster was a Zan(they are awesome to me) It had 450-750-200-800-150 then he changed into a Gai(a Morx subtype). I decided to raise another Zan after that and gave it the heart of the other Zan and it had 500-999-4-999-200. Both of them beat all of the top five and the Strongest monster Ragnarox their first time. So giving a monster with the same stats raise the stats better as I figured, but do the hearts give to life like a gold peach?

Anyway...

-Adios
